questionnaire.title: irAKI vs Other AKI Classification Assessment
questionnaire.reference: Sprangers et al. Nature Reviews Nephrology 2022

questions.question: The temporal relationship between immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI) exposure and AKI onset strongly supports irAKI diagnosis
Prerenal causes of AKI have been adequately excluded
Postrenal/obstructive causes of AKI have been adequately excluded
Other intrinsic causes of AKI (ATN, contrast nephropathy, other drugs) have been adequately excluded
Urinalysis findings are consistent with immune-mediated kidney injury
Laboratory evidence suggests systemic immune activation consistent with irAKI
Concomitant medications known to cause AKI/ATIN have been adequately assessed and excluded
The presence of other immune-related adverse events (irAEs) supports the diagnosis of irAKI
Kidney biopsy is indicated and expected to show findings consistent with immune-mediated injury
The clinical course and expected response pattern are consistent with irAKI
Alternative systemic diagnoses for AKI have been systematically excluded
Overall clinical judgment strongly favors irAKI as the most likely diagnosis
Infection-related AKI (septic ATN, pyelonephritis, other infectious causes) has been systematically excluded
Radiologic findings support immune-mediated kidney injury or exclude alternative structural causes
Baseline renal reserve, age-related changes, and frailty have been appropriately considered in AKI assessment
The risk-benefit profile supports rechallenge with ICI therapy after AKI recovery

interpretation.1-3: Evidence strongly against irAKI / Alternative diagnosis likely
interpretation.7-9: Evidence strongly supports irAKI / High probability diagnosis

confidence_thresholds.high_confidence: ≥7 on ≥12 questions with no major contradictions
confidence_thresholds.moderate_confidence: ≥6 on most questions with some uncertainty

consensus_calculation.minimum_agreement: ≥70% of experts within 2 points on final gestalt

recommendations: Consider irAKI if clinical course changes
Address baseline CKD and frailty factors
